Content: Railway Trade Unions have called off their indefinite strike. The Railway Unions began at midnight yesterday. It was agreed to call of the work stoppage following discussions held with the Transport Ministry today. Railway Unions had launched a strike after the Transport Ministry had allegedly exerted pressure on the Railways General Manager for taking disciplinary action on an officer who had consumed liquor during work hours. Representatives of trade unions met with the Transport Minister Arjuna Ranatunga and State Minister Ashoka Abeysinghe for discussions after which they decided to call off the strike.
